Name: Illusory rectangles demo
Description:
Straight lines appear to curve.

(Note: Demo title is "Buckingham illusion", but the illusion was only shared by Buckingham, not created by him, so the attribution is incorrect. This illusion appears to be unnamed.)
Author: Arthur Shapiro

Name: Illusory rectangles
Description: Illusory (Gestalt?) tilted rectangles are observed at crosses.
Author: Kitaoka

Name: Black And White Spirals
Description: Concentric circles appear to be spirals.
Author: Kitaoka

Name: Colorful Spirals
Description:
Concentric circles appear to be spirals.

[there is also illusory motion]
Author: Akiyoshi Kitaoka

Name: The Dress
Description:
From Wikipedia:

The dress is a photograph that became a viral phenomenon on the Internet in 2015. Viewers of the image disagreed on whether the dress depicted was coloured black and blue, or white and gold. The phenomenon revealed differences in human colour perception, which have been the subject of ongoing scientific investigations into neuroscience and vision science, producing a number of papers published in peer-reviewed scientific journals.
Author: Cecilia Bleasdale

Name: Hermann grid
Description: The Hermann grid illusion is an optical illusion reported by Ludimar Hermann in 1870.[1] The illusion is characterized by "ghostlike" grey blobs perceived at the intersections of a white (or light-colored) grid on a black background. The grey blobs disappear when looking directly at an intersection.

Name: Pink Knots
Description: Straight lines appear to be knotting. Origin unknown.
Author: Unknown

Name: Cobbles
Description:
From the author's page:

So yes, I really made that optical illusion….
…..And no- there’s no curved lines!

I liked his watermark better than the one i used in my Patreon post. I struggle with watermarking my work (obviously!)

I posted it publicly on Facebook before anywhere else, but left my name off. After all, I illustrate totally different things for a living, I thought it was just “cool looking” so I threw it up there on a lark.

Sorta the same thing on Reddit.

Short of a giant watermark in the middle it’s hard to keep my name attached, so if you see anyone else claiming credit, please consider letting me know. Im a disabled artist who side gigs my way the the work day- it would be great to have ownership of my wirk.

If you’re dubious I have all the original files including video of the “tile” being made.

I’m happy to answer questions and yes, there are more coming!

And now you can get everything from a jigsaw puzzle to a poster on Redbubble:

www.redbubble.com/people/Lesha…

If you want first access please consider being a Patreon patron! (Patreon/leshasillustrations)

Thanks all for enjoying this! You made my holiday season!

-Lesha
Author: Lesha Porche

Name: Munker Hearts
Description: 青から紫へのハートと緑からオレンジへのハート
Author: Kitaoka, from Munker
Publication: (original) Munker, H. (1970) Farbige Gitter, Abbildung auf der Netzhaut und übertragungstheoretische Beschreibung der Farbwahrnehmung. Habilitationsschrift, Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität, München.

Name: Confetti illusion
Description: The Munker illusion, which produces two apparently different hues from a base color, can be extended to multiple apparent colors. By having foreground stripes in more than two colors, it is possible to create multiple foreground colors that lead to multiple apparent hues in the base objects. This technique works well for three colors and can be extended to four, six, and even ten colors.
Author: David Novick, Akiyoshi Kitaoka

Name: Expanding black holes
Description: Black holes appear to expand.
Author: Kitaoka

Name: Out of Focus
Description: The inset appears to fluctuate.
Author: Kitaoka

Name: Rotating snakes: a gray scale version
Description: Each disk appears to rotate 'spontaneously' in the constant direction, from black to dark gray, white, light gray, back to black.
Author: Kitaoka

Name: Heat devil #6
Description: The image appears to wave or to be like a heat devil
Author: Kitaoka

Name: A through
Description: The left half appears to move leftward while the right half rightward.
Author: Kitaoka

Name: Dorayaki
Description: Rows of dorayaki (kinds of cakes) move.
Author: Kitaoka

Name: Trampoline
Description: The inset appears to move. This figure consists of squares.
Author: Kitaoka

Name: Makudonarudo
Description:
*Japanese pronunciation of McDonald's

Each row appears to move in the horizontal direction.
Author: Kitaoka

Name: Watashi
Description:
*Ferry boat

The inset appears to move in the horizontal direction.
Author: Kitaoka

Name: Motion of snakes 2021
Description: Each row appears to move laterally.
Author: Akiyoshi Kitaoka

Name: Rotating Snakes
Description: 蛇の円盤が勝手に回転して見える
Author: Kitaoka

Name: Blue train 2021
Description: The upper half appears to move leftward while the lower one rightward.
Author: Kitaoka
